underacozy.title: The More or Less Definitive Guide to Self-Care
underacozy.description: In the last few years, the concept of self-care has evolved from sheet masks and Friday nights in to making a more concentrated effort to put yourself and your needs first (though we still love our sheet masks). In this life-changing and essential new A-to-Z guide, Anna Borges outlines tips, stories, advice, and activities on everything from how to ask for help to how to get a better night’s sleep.
ingredientLines: 4 baby chickens (poussins) or cornish hens (about 1 1/4 pounds each), or 4 chicken breast halves
1 tablespoon crushed red-pepper flakes, or to taste

underacozy.title: The Witches Are Coming
underacozy.description: Lindy West wrote a new book. Need we say more? Okay, we will: It’s fantastic and necessary reading. Whether she’s examining female anger, revisiting the real problem with Twitter trolls, or pondering whether Adam Sandler is funny or not, every essay finds a way to speak to your soul and get you fired up about the state of the world and your place in it. If this book isn’t at the tippy top of your reading list, it needs to be there ASAP.
ingredientLines: 2 or 3 links of chineses sausage, cut into 1/4 inch slices
Finely chopped green onion or cilantro

underacozy.title: Little Weirds by Jenny Slate
underacozy.description: If you’ve ever watched Jenny Slate’s movies or standup and thought, “I really wish I could be friends with her,” pick up this book. Her collection of mini essays dives into everything from feminism and “emotional horniness” (her words) to death and divorce. It’s poetic, heartfelt, and deeply personal.
ingredientLines: 40 chicken wing pieces, or 20 whole chicken wings
Kosher salt and freshly ground black pepper
1/3 to 1/2 cup chopped fresh cilantro leaves
1/4 cup light or regular sour cream
Juice 1/2 lemon (or why not try lime?)

underacozy.title: Get a Life, Chloe Brown
underacozy.description: Now that it’s officially Hallmark Christmas movie season, you probably have an appetite for rom-coms of all kinds. Don’t miss this sweet contemporary romance about a girl hoping to cross off items on her “Get a Life” bucket list—and the unlikely hott guy who can help her.
ingredientLines: 1.0 tbsp vinegar (you can use cider, malt or wine)

underacozy.title: In the Dream House
underacozy.description: This is not an easy read, but it’s a very, very important one. Carmen Maria Machado’s bravely candid memoir about violence, identity, and an abusive same-sex relationship is truly remarkable.
ingredientLines: 6 to 8 fresh long rice cake sticks, or 20 smaller rice cake sticks
3 to 4 tablespoons light soy sauce, depending on saltiness

underacozy.title: The Revisioners
underacozy.description: If you like epic family sagas that span generations, this one’s for you. The Revisioners takes place across three generations of black women, from 1855 to the present day. Cancel your plans, because you won’t want to put it down.
ingredientLines: 1 box (about 18 oz.) yellow or white cake mix

underacozy.title: Who Do You Think You Are?: A Journal That’s All About You
underacozy.description: It’s never too early to start thinking about New Year’s resolutions. Get a head start on becoming the best “you” possible with this illustrated guided journal. It’s filled with fun prompts that invite you to write, reflect, and consider all the little moments that brought you here today.
ingredientLines: 2 1/2 cups self-rising white lily or cake flour

underacozy.title: That’s Mental: Painfully Funny Things That Drive Me Crazy About Being Mentally Ill
underacozy.description: There’s always room for another mental health memoir on our shelves, and Amanda Rosenberg’s is a must-read. In That’s Mental, she gets painfully real about all of the dark and difficult sides to being mentally ill. But she also explores the funny, awkward, embarrassing, and inappropriate sides, too. You’ll laugh out loud as you read along.
ingredientLines: 1 tbsp butter for creamed chanterelle mushroom sauce
Salt and freshly ground black pepp
